Package PayrollProcessing

Class Company

java.lang.Object
PayrollProcessing.Company
public class Company
extends java.lang.Object
Company class representing database of Employees.
Author:
Connie Chen, Tiffany Lee

  • Constructor Details

    • Company

      public Company()
      Default Company constructor to create an empty Employee database.

  • Method Details

    • getNumEmployee

      public int getNumEmployee()
      Accesses the numEmployee data member of a Company.
      Returns:
      int representing the number of Employees in the Company.

    • find

      private int find​(Employee employee)
      Finds the index number of the given Employee in the Company object.
      Parameters:
      employee - being searched for.
      Returns:
      int representing the index number of the Employee in the empList array.

    • grow

      private void grow()
      Increases the Employee database capacity (empList) by 4.

    • add

      public boolean add​(Employee employee)
      Inserts an Employee Object in the Company database.
      Parameters:
      employee - to be added to the empList array of Company.
      Returns:
      true if the Employee was added, false otherwise.

    • remove

      public boolean remove​(Employee employee)
      Removes the given Employee from the Company database.
      Parameters:
      employee - to be removed.
      Returns:
      true if the Employee was successfully removed, false otherwise.

    • setHours

      public boolean setHours​(Employee employee)
      Modifies the hoursWorked for a Parttime Employee.
      Parameters:
      employee - to be modified.
      Returns:
      true if the working hours were successfully modified, false otherwise.

    • processPayments

      public void processPayments()
      Processes the payment of all Employees in the Company database.

    • print

      public java.lang.String print()
      Returns a String of all Employee Objects in the Company database as is.

    • printByDepartment

      public java.lang.String printByDepartment()
      Returns a String of all Employee Objects in the Company database sorted by Department.

    • printByDate

      public java.lang.String printByDate()
      Returns a String of the list of Employee Objects in the Company by dateHired.

    • quickSort

      public void quickSort​(Employee[] database, int low, int high, boolean sortType)
      Sorts the empList array in ascending order depending on the sortType using the Quick Sort algorithm.
      Parameters:
      database - of Employees.
      low - the beginning index of the array to be sorted.
      high - the ending index of the array to be sorted.
      sortType - defines whether sorting BY_DATE or BY_DEPARTMENT.

    • partition

      public int partition​(Employee[] database, int low, int high, boolean sortType)
      Helper method for Quick Sort Algorithm that partitions the array to swap elements.
      Parameters:
      database - of Employees.
      low - the beginning index of the array to partition.
      high - the ending index of the array to partition.
      sortType - defines whether sorting BY_DATE or BY_DEPARTMENT.
      Returns:
      index of element to be partitioned.

    • compareDepartment

      public boolean compareDepartment​(Employee emp1, Employee emp2)
      Compares the department type of two Employee objects.
      Parameters:
      emp1 - to be compared.
      emp2 - to be compared.
      Returns:
      true if emp1 department type is alphabetically earlier than emp2's, false otherwise.

    • exportDatabase

      public boolean exportDatabase​(java.io.File exportFile)
      Writes the employee database from the array to given text file.
      Parameters:
      exportFile - to be written to
      Returns:
      true if export is successful, false otherwise
